items.title: Awesome Dotnet Core
items.content_text:
### Frameworks, Libraries and Tools / GUI

*   [AvaloniaEdit (‚≠ê936)](https://github.com/AvaloniaUI/AvaloniaEdit/) - The Avalonia-based text editor component forked from [AvalonEdit (‚≠ê2k)](https://github.com/icsharpcode/AvalonEdit)
    [HandyControls (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/ghost1372/HandyControls) - Contains some simple and commonly used WPF controls.

Frameworks, Libraries and Tools / GUI

  • AvaloniaEdit (‚≠ê936) - The Avalonia-based text editor component forked from AvalonEdit (‚≠ê2k) HandyControls (‚≠ê1.2k) - Contains some simple and commonly used WPF controls.

items.title: Awesome Kde
items.content_text:
### Utilities & Tools

*   [Wacom GUI (‚≠ê139)](https://github.com/tb2097/wacom-gui) - Python/PyQt Wacom GUI for KDE.

### Education

*   [LabPlot](https://labplot.kde.org/) - Interactive graphing and analysis of scientific data üìå.

### Plasma desktop / Extensions

*   [Hoppla (‚≠ê67)](https://github.com/Fuchs/hoppla-sa) - KDE Plasma desktop widget to control Philips Hue lights.
*   [Places Widget (‚≠ê13)](https://github.com/dfaust/plasma-applet-places-widget) - Plasma 5 widget that gives access to user places.
*   [Window AppMenu Applet (‚≠ê423)](https://github.com/psifidotos/applet-window-appmenu) - Plasma 5 applet in order to show the window appmenu.

### Plasma desktop / Themes

*   [Canta (‚≠ê78)](https://github.com/vinceliuice/Canta-kde) - A flat design theme for KDE Plasma desktop.
*   [Darkine KDE (‚≠ê45)](https://github.com/Rokin05/darkine-kde) - Theme for KDE Plasma 5 desktop, SDDM and more.
*   [Layan (‚≠ê432)](https://github.com/vinceliuice/Layan-kde) - A flat design theme for KDE Plasma desktop.

### Plasma desktop / Qt and GTK+ Applications Appearance

*   [Breeze10 (‚≠ê102)](https://github.com/fauzie811/Breeze10) - A Windows 10 style windows decoration for KDE Plasma.
*   [BreezeBlurred (‚≠ê201)](https://github.com/alex47/BreezeBlurred) - A fork of KDE Breeze window decoration written in Qt C++.
*   [BreezeEnhanced (‚≠ê179)](https://github.com/tsujan/BreezeEnhanced) - A fork of KDE Breeze decoration with additional options.
*   [Sweet KDE (‚≠ê226)](https://github.com/EliverLara/Sweet-kde) - A dark and modern theme for KDE plasma.
*   [XBoomer (‚≠ê91)](https://github.com/efskap/XBoomer) - XP Window Decorations for KDE Plasma.

### Plasma desktop / Icons

*   [La Capitaine (‚≠ê2k)](https://github.com/keeferrourke/la-capitaine-icon-theme) - Icon pack with inspiration taken from the latest iterations of macOS and Google's Material Design.
*   [Tela (‚≠ê1.7k)](https://github.com/vinceliuice/Tela-icon-theme) - A flat colorful Design icon theme.

### Plasma desktop / Scripts

*   [Grid-Tiling-Kwin (‚≠ê913)](https://github.com/lingtjien/Grid-Tiling-Kwin) - A kwin script that automatically tiles windows.

### Plasma desktop / Display Manager

*   [Chili (‚≠ê215)](https://github.com/MarianArlt/kde-plasma-chili) - The hottest login theme around for KDE Plasma 5.
*   [Delicious (‚≠ê109)](https://github.com/stuomas/delicious-sddm-theme) - A delicious SDDM theme for DE collectors/addicts.
*   [Sugar Candy](https://framagit.org/MarianArlt/sddm-sugar-candy) - The sweetest login theme available for the SDDM display manager.
items.content_html:
Utilities & Tools

  • Wacom GUI (‚≠ê139) - Python/PyQt Wacom GUI for KDE.

Education

  • LabPlot - Interactive graphing and analysis of scientific data üìå.

Plasma desktop / Extensions

  • Hoppla (‚≠ê67) - KDE Plasma desktop widget to control Philips Hue lights.
  • Places Widget (‚≠ê13) - Plasma 5 widget that gives access to user places.
  • Window AppMenu Applet (‚≠ê423) - Plasma 5 applet in order to show the window appmenu.

Plasma desktop / Themes

  • Canta (‚≠ê78) - A flat design theme for KDE Plasma desktop.
  • Darkine KDE (‚≠ê45) - Theme for KDE Plasma 5 desktop, SDDM and more.
  • Layan (‚≠ê432) - A flat design theme for KDE Plasma desktop.

Plasma desktop / Qt and GTK+ Applications Appearance

  • Breeze10 (‚≠ê102) - A Windows 10 style windows decoration for KDE Plasma.
  • BreezeBlurred (‚≠ê201) - A fork of KDE Breeze window decoration written in Qt C++.
  • BreezeEnhanced (‚≠ê179) - A fork of KDE Breeze decoration with additional options.
  • Sweet KDE (‚≠ê226) - A dark and modern theme for KDE plasma.
  • XBoomer (‚≠ê91) - XP Window Decorations for KDE Plasma.

Plasma desktop / Icons

  • La Capitaine (‚≠ê2k) - Icon pack with inspiration taken from the latest iterations of macOS and Google's Material Design.
  • Tela (‚≠ê1.7k) - A flat colorful Design icon theme.

Plasma desktop / Scripts

  • Grid-Tiling-Kwin (‚≠ê913) - A kwin script that automatically tiles windows.

Plasma desktop / Display Manager

  • Chili (‚≠ê215) - The hottest login theme around for KDE Plasma 5.
  • Delicious (‚≠ê109) - A delicious SDDM theme for DE collectors/addicts.
  • Sugar Candy - The sweetest login theme available for the SDDM display manager.

items.title: Awesome Embedded Rust
items.content_text:
### HAL implementation crates / GigaDevice

*   [`gd32vf103xx-hal`](https://github.com/riscv-rust/gd32vf103xx-hal) - [![crates.io](https://img.shields.io/crates/v/gd32vf103xx-hal.svg)](https://crates.io/crates/gd32vf103xx-hal)
    *   HAL for GD32VF103xx microcontrollers

### Board support crates / SeeedStudio

*   [`seedstudio-gd32v`](https://github.com/riscv-rust/seedstudio-gd32v) - Board support crate for the [GD32 RISC-V Dev Board](https://www.seeedstudio.com/SeeedStudio-GD32-RISC-V-Dev-Board-p-4302.html)
    [![crates.io](https://img.shields.io/crates/v/seedstudio-gd32v.svg)](https://crates.io/crates/seedstudio-gd32v)
    *   Contains runnable examples for this board

### Board support crates / Sipeed

*   [`longan-nano`](https://github.com/riscv-rust/longan-nano) - Board support package for the [Longan Nano board](https://www.seeedstudio.com/Sipeed-Longan-Nano-RISC-V-GD32VF103CBT6-Development-Board-p-4205.html)
    [![crates.io](https://img.shields.io/crates/v/longan-nano.svg)](https://crates.io/crates/longan-nano)
    *   Contains runnable examples for this board
items.content_html:
HAL implementation crates / GigaDevice

  • gd32vf103xx-hal -
    • HAL for GD32VF103xx microcontrollers

Board support crates / SeeedStudio

  • seedstudio-gd32v - Board support crate for the GD32 RISC-V Dev Board
    • Contains runnable examples for this board

Board support crates / Sipeed

  • longan-nano - Board support package for the Longan Nano board
    • Contains runnable examples for this board

items.title: Awesome Mqtt
items.content_text:
### Cloud

*   [Alibaba Cloud IoT Platform](https://www.alibabacloud.com/product/iot) - Provides secure and reliable communication between devices and the IoT Platform which allows you to manage a large number of devices on a single IoT Platform.
*   [AWS IoT Core](https://aws.amazon.com/iot-core/?nc1=h_ls) - AWS IoT Core is a managed cloud service that lets connected devices easily and securely interact with cloud applications and other devices. AWS IoT Core can support billions of devices and trillions of messages, and can process and route those messages to AWS endpoints and to other devices reliably and securely. With AWS IoT Core, your applications can keep track of and communicate with all your devices, all the time, even when they aren‚Äôt connected.
*   [Azure IoT Hub](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/iot-hub/) - Enable highly secure and reliable communication between your IoT application and the devices it manages. Azure IoT Hub provides a cloud-hosted solution backend to connect virtually any device. Extend your solution from the cloud to the edge with per-device authentication, built-in device management, and scaled provisioning.
*   [flespi](https://flespi.com/mqtt-broker) - Free and secure cloud MQTT broker with private namespaces, MQTT 3.1.1 and MQTT 5.0 support and gorgeous limits.
*   [IBM WATSON](https://www.ibm.com/watson) - With Watson, you can bring AI tools and apps to your data wherever it resides ‚Äì whether it's on IBM Cloud, AWS, Azure, Google, or your own private cloud platform.

### Clients

*   [mqtt.dart (‚≠ê51)](https://github.com/jnguillerme/mqtt.dart) - Dart MQTT client.
*   [rumqtt (‚≠ê202)](https://github.com/AtherEnergy/rumqtt) - A fast, lock free pure Rust MQTT client.

### Makers / ESP

*   [ESP32-BLE2MQTT (‚≠ê727)](https://github.com/shmuelzon/esp32-ble2mqtt) - BLE to MQTT bridge, exposes BLE GATT characteristics as MQTT topics for bidirectional communication.
*   [ESP8266MQTTMesh (‚≠ê268)](https://github.com/PhracturedBlue/ESP8266MQTTMesh) - MQTT over mesh WiFi integrated library for ESP8266
*   [esp\_mqtt (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/tuanpmt/esp_mqtt) - MQTT client library for ESP8266.
*   [nodemcu-gpiomqtt (‚≠ê10)](https://github.com/hobbyquaker/nodemcu-gpiomqtt) - Lua script to connect ESP8266 GPIOs to MQTT.

### Smart Home Hardware Interfaces / Firmwares for ESP based Devices

*   [ipcam2mqtt (‚≠ê26)](https://github.com/svrooij/ipcam2mqtt) - A small FTP server to receive movement images from ipcameras and turn them into MQTT alerts.

### Misc / Firmwares for ESP based Devices

*   [AlexaMqttBridge (‚≠ê107)](https://github.com/mhdawson/AlexaMqttBridge) - Bridge between Amazon Alexa and MQTT.
*   [buderus2mqtt (‚≠ê16)](https://github.com/krambox/buderus2mqtt) - Bridge between Buderus KM200 internet gateway and MQTT.
*   [kobold2mqtt (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/krambox/kobold2mqtt) - Bridge between Vorwerk Kobold Vr200 internet gateway and MQTT.
*   [leaf-python-mqtt (‚≠ê25)](https://github.com/glynhudson/leaf-python-mqtt) - Extract data from Nissan Leaf API and post to MQTT.

### Visualization, Dashboards / Firmwares for ESP based Devices

*   [mqtt2highcharts (‚≠ê62)](https://github.com/matbor/mqtt2highcharts) - Plotting live numbered data from a subscribed MQTT topic using Highcharts.

### Security, Encryption / Firmwares for ESP based Devices

*   [Teserakt E4](https://teserakt.io/) - End-to-end encryption and key management for MQTT and other M2M protocols ‚Äì Open-source and paid plans.
items.content_html:
Cloud

  • Alibaba Cloud IoT Platform - Provides secure and reliable communication between devices and the IoT Platform which allows you to manage a large number of devices on a single IoT Platform.
  • AWS IoT Core - AWS IoT Core is a managed cloud service that lets connected devices easily and securely interact with cloud applications and other devices. AWS IoT Core can support billions of devices and trillions of messages, and can process and route those messages to AWS endpoints and to other devices reliably and securely. With AWS IoT Core, your applications can keep track of and communicate with all your devices, all the time, even when they aren‚Äôt connected.
  • Azure IoT Hub - Enable highly secure and reliable communication between your IoT application and the devices it manages. Azure IoT Hub provides a cloud-hosted solution backend to connect virtually any device. Extend your solution from the cloud to the edge with per-device authentication, built-in device management, and scaled provisioning.
  • flespi - Free and secure cloud MQTT broker with private namespaces, MQTT 3.1.1 and MQTT 5.0 support and gorgeous limits.
  • IBM WATSON - With Watson, you can bring AI tools and apps to your data wherever it resides ‚Äì whether it's on IBM Cloud, AWS, Azure, Google, or your own private cloud platform.

Clients

  • mqtt.dart (‚≠ê51) - Dart MQTT client.
  • rumqtt (‚≠ê202) - A fast, lock free pure Rust MQTT client.

Makers / ESP

  • ESP32-BLE2MQTT (‚≠ê727) - BLE to MQTT bridge, exposes BLE GATT characteristics as MQTT topics for bidirectional communication.
  • ESP8266MQTTMesh (‚≠ê268) - MQTT over mesh WiFi integrated library for ESP8266
  • esp_mqtt (‚≠ê1.1k) - MQTT client library for ESP8266.
  • nodemcu-gpiomqtt (‚≠ê10) - Lua script to connect ESP8266 GPIOs to MQTT.

Smart Home Hardware Interfaces / Firmwares for ESP based Devices

  • ipcam2mqtt (‚≠ê26) - A small FTP server to receive movement images from ipcameras and turn them into MQTT alerts.

Misc / Firmwares for ESP based Devices

  • AlexaMqttBridge (‚≠ê107) - Bridge between Amazon Alexa and MQTT.
  • buderus2mqtt (‚≠ê16) - Bridge between Buderus KM200 internet gateway and MQTT.
  • kobold2mqtt (‚≠ê2) - Bridge between Vorwerk Kobold Vr200 internet gateway and MQTT.
  • leaf-python-mqtt (‚≠ê25) - Extract data from Nissan Leaf API and post to MQTT.

Visualization, Dashboards / Firmwares for ESP based Devices

  • mqtt2highcharts (‚≠ê62) - Plotting live numbered data from a subscribed MQTT topic using Highcharts.

Security, Encryption / Firmwares for ESP based Devices

  • Teserakt E4 - End-to-end encryption and key management for MQTT and other M2M protocols ‚Äì Open-source and paid plans.

items.title: Awesome Cl
items.content_text:
### C

*   [cl-gobject-introspection (‚≠ê52)](https://github.com/andy128k/cl-gobject-introspection) - [Gobject Introspection](https://gi.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) FFI. Automatic bindings to call into the C library. [BSD](https://directory.fsf.org/wiki/License:BSD_3Clause). Generate a lisp interface with [gir2cl (‚≠ê7)](https://github.com/kat-co/gir2cl). [LGPL3](https://www.gnu.org/licenses/lgpl-3.0.en.html).
items.content_html:
C

items.title: Awesome Machine Learning
items.content_text:
### Python / Computer Vision

*   [Detectron (‚≠ê26k)](https://github.com/facebookresearch/Detectron) - FAIR's software system that implements state-of-the-art object detection algorithms, including Mask R-CNN. It is written in Python and powered by the Caffe2 deep learning framework. **\[Deprecated]**
*   [Detecto (‚≠ê620)](https://github.com/alankbi/detecto) - Train and run a computer vision model with 5-10 lines of code.

### Python / Natural Language Processing

*   [PySS3 (‚≠ê342)](https://github.com/sergioburdisso/pyss3) - Python package that implements a novel white-box machine learning model for text classification, called SS3. Since SS3 has the ability to visually explain its rationale, this package also comes with easy-to-use interactive visualizations tools ([online demos](http://tworld.io/ss3/)).
items.content_html:
Python / Computer Vision

  • Detectron (‚≠ê26k) - FAIR's software system that implements state-of-the-art object detection algorithms, including Mask R-CNN. It is written in Python and powered by the Caffe2 deep learning framework. [Deprecated]
  • Detecto (‚≠ê620) - Train and run a computer vision model with 5-10 lines of code.

Python / Natural Language Processing

  • PySS3 (‚≠ê342) - Python package that implements a novel white-box machine learning model for text classification, called SS3. Since SS3 has the ability to visually explain its rationale, this package also comes with easy-to-use interactive visualizations tools (online demos).

Data Structures and Algorithms

  • Swift Algorithms & Data Structures by Wayne Bishop

Network

items.title: Awesome Esp
items.content_text:
### Firmware

*   [MongooseOS (‚≠ê2.6k)](https://github.com/cesanta/mongoose-os) - An IoT specific firmware, with both C and JS. Available for the ESP32/8266.

### Tools

*   [ESPTool-ck (‚≠ê370)](https://github.com/igrr/esptool-ck) - A CLI tool for flashing in the ESP8266.
*   [ESPTool-gui (‚≠ê197)](https://github.com/Rodmg/esptool-gui) - A flashing GUI tool based on ESPTool-ck.
*   [LuaNode (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/Nicholas3388/LuaNode) - A lua-only SDK for 32/8266.

### Projects / Smart Home and IoT

*   [OpenMQTTGateway (‚≠ê3.8k)](https://github.com/1technophile/OpenMQTTGateway) - An implementation of a multiprotocol MQTT gateway for both ESP's among other devices.
*   [ESPHome](https://esphome.io/) - A full-featured system for controlling ESP's through simple yet powerful configuration files and Home Automation systems.
*   [Sonoff-Homekit (‚≠ê1k)](https://github.com/Gruppio/Sonoff-Homekit) - An alternative firmware for Sonoff devices (and other 8266 devices) which allows control through Apple's Homekit.
*   [EPaperWeatherDisplay (‚≠ê155)](https://github.com/henri98/esp32-e-paper-weatherdisplay) - A very cute e-ink weather display using the ESP32.
*   [SuperGreenOS (‚≠ê193)](https://github.com/supergreenlab/SuperGreenOS) - A full-featured home farming automation software for the ESP32.

### Projects / InfoSec

*   [ESP32-BLECollector (‚≠ê323)](https://github.com/tobozo/ESP32-BLECollector) - A wardriving device which displays BLE devices and collects data from them, all in a nice screen interface.
*   [ArduinoPcap (‚≠ê442)](https://github.com/spacehuhn/ArduinoPcap) - A library which allows generation of .pcap files with network traffic, for both ESP's.
*   [WiFi Satellite](https://hackaday.io/project/28831-wifi-satellite-34c3) - A giant Wifi "satellite" that can monitor all 14 2.4Ghz channels using, well, 14 ESP32s.
*   [ESP8266 Deauther (‚≠ê14k)](https://github.com/spacehuhn/esp8266_deauther) - A very cool pseudojammer (deauther) of Wifi networks that uses the ESP8266.
*   [PacketMonitor (‚≠ê379)](https://github.com/spacehuhn/PacketMonitor32) - A beautiful OLED monitor for packet activity in a WiFi channel. Two versions for each ESP.
*   [WiFiDuck (‚≠ê2.3k)](https://github.com/spacehuhn/WiFiDuck) - A wireless-enabled keystroke injector, analogous, but even more awesome than the Rubber Ducky.
*   [ESP8266 Beacon Spam (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/spacehuhn/esp8266_beaconSpam) - Want to confuse people? This device creates hundreds of fake WiFi networks.
*   [DeauthDetector (‚≠ê861)](https://github.com/spacehuhn/DeauthDetector) - A small device that shines a light if it detects a WiFi deauth attack. Made by the same guy as the last six projects.

### Projects / Biomedical

*   [HeartyPatch](https://heartypatch.protocentral.com/) - A wearable BLE and WiFi connected ECG-HR patch which uses the ESP32.
*   [HealthyPi v4](https://www.crowdsupply.com/protocentral/healthypi-v4-unplugged) - An amazing open source vital signs monitor that can monitor ECG, respiration, pulse oximetry and body temperature, all run by an ESP32.

### Projects / Others

*   [SoftRF (‚≠ê882)](https://github.com/lyusupov/SoftRF) - A DIY aviation proximity awareness system that can be used in UAV projects.
*   [Retro ESP32 (‚≠ê648)](https://github.com/retro-esp32/RetroESP32) - An extremely cool launcher for the Odroid Go (with the ESP32), which allows emulating several retro consoles.
*   [DroneBridge (‚≠ê532)](https://github.com/DroneBridge/ESP32) - An implementation of DroneBridge, a signal link for drones and UAV's on the ESP32.

### Libraries / Others

*   [Wasm3 (‚≠ê7.6k)](https://github.com/wasm3/wasm3) - A lightning fast WebAssembly interpreter designed for embedded devices, compatible with both ESP's.
*   [ESP-Dash (‚≠ê1k)](https://github.com/ayushsharma82/ESP-DASH) - Beautiful and fast framework for creating remote dashboards in the 8266/32. No internet required.
*   [GUIslice (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/ImpulseAdventure/GUIslice) - A drag and drop GUI framework for several devices and screen controllers. Compatible with 8266 and 32.
*   [MicroWebSrv2 (‚≠ê685)](https://github.com/jczic/MicroWebSrv2) - A very powerful MicroPython web server which can be used in the ESP32.
*   [TTS (‚≠ê205)](https://github.com/jscrane/TTS) - A somehow good text to speech library for several Arduino devices, both ESP's included.
*   [Koyn (‚≠ê66)](https://github.com/elkrem/koyn) - A decentralized Bitcoin library for the ESP32 and the ESP8266.
*   [UTFT-ESP (‚≠ê91)](https://github.com/gnulabis/UTFT-ESP) - UTFT Support for the ESP32/8266.
*   [TinyGSM (‚≠ê2.1k)](https://github.com/vshymanskyy/TinyGSM) - A quick and simple Arduino library for interaction with GSM modules which can also control the 8266 through AT commands.
*   [mJS (‚≠ê2k)](https://github.com/cesanta/mjs) - A lightweight and restricted JS engine that is used by MongooseOS, compatible on the 32 and 8266.
*   [ESPUI (‚≠ê1k)](https://github.com/s00500/ESPUI) - A simply library for making interactive web interfaces for both ESP's.
*   [ESP32 ePaper (‚≠ê232)](https://github.com/loboris/ESP32_ePaper_example) - A full-featured library for using ePaper modules with the ESP32.
*   [TinyUPnP (‚≠ê106)](https://github.com/ofekp/TinyUPnP) - A lightweight UPnP IGD library for automatic port forwarding on the 8266 and 32.
*   [Esp32SSHClient (‚≠ê47)](https://github.com/J-Rios/Arduino-esp32sshclient) - A library that implements a SSH client in the ESP32.
items.content_html:
Firmware

  • MongooseOS (‚≠ê2.6k) - An IoT specific firmware, with both C and JS. Available for the ESP32/8266.

Tools

  • ESPTool-ck (‚≠ê370) - A CLI tool for flashing in the ESP8266.
  • ESPTool-gui (‚≠ê197) - A flashing GUI tool based on ESPTool-ck.
  • LuaNode (‚≠ê1.2k) - A lua-only SDK for 32/8266.

  • OpenMQTTGateway (‚≠ê3.8k) - An implementation of a multiprotocol MQTT gateway for both ESP's among other devices.
  • ESPHome - A full-featured system for controlling ESP's through simple yet powerful configuration files and Home Automation systems.
  • Sonoff-Homekit (‚≠ê1k) - An alternative firmware for Sonoff devices (and other 8266 devices) which allows control through Apple's Homekit.
  • EPaperWeatherDisplay (‚≠ê155) - A very cute e-ink weather display using the ESP32.
  • SuperGreenOS (‚≠ê193) - A full-featured home farming automation software for the ESP32.

Projects / InfoSec

  • ESP32-BLECollector (‚≠ê323) - A wardriving device which displays BLE devices and collects data from them, all in a nice screen interface.
  • ArduinoPcap (‚≠ê442) - A library which allows generation of .pcap files with network traffic, for both ESP's.
  • WiFi Satellite - A giant Wifi "satellite" that can monitor all 14 2.4Ghz channels using, well, 14 ESP32s.
  • ESP8266 Deauther (‚≠ê14k) - A very cool pseudojammer (deauther) of Wifi networks that uses the ESP8266.
  • PacketMonitor (‚≠ê379) - A beautiful OLED monitor for packet activity in a WiFi channel. Two versions for each ESP.
  • WiFiDuck (‚≠ê2.3k) - A wireless-enabled keystroke injector, analogous, but even more awesome than the Rubber Ducky.
  • ESP8266 Beacon Spam (‚≠ê1.1k) - Want to confuse people? This device creates hundreds of fake WiFi networks.
  • DeauthDetector (‚≠ê861) - A small device that shines a light if it detects a WiFi deauth attack. Made by the same guy as the last six projects.

Projects / Biomedical

  • HeartyPatch - A wearable BLE and WiFi connected ECG-HR patch which uses the ESP32.
  • HealthyPi v4 - An amazing open source vital signs monitor that can monitor ECG, respiration, pulse oximetry and body temperature, all run by an ESP32.

Projects / Others

  • SoftRF (‚≠ê882) - A DIY aviation proximity awareness system that can be used in UAV projects.
  • Retro ESP32 (‚≠ê648) - An extremely cool launcher for the Odroid Go (with the ESP32), which allows emulating several retro consoles.
  • DroneBridge (‚≠ê532) - An implementation of DroneBridge, a signal link for drones and UAV's on the ESP32.

Libraries / Others

  • Wasm3 (‚≠ê7.6k) - A lightning fast WebAssembly interpreter designed for embedded devices, compatible with both ESP's.
  • ESP-Dash (‚≠ê1k) - Beautiful and fast framework for creating remote dashboards in the 8266/32. No internet required.
  • GUIslice (‚≠ê1.3k) - A drag and drop GUI framework for several devices and screen controllers. Compatible with 8266 and 32.
  • MicroWebSrv2 (‚≠ê685) - A very powerful MicroPython web server which can be used in the ESP32.
  • TTS (‚≠ê205) - A somehow good text to speech library for several Arduino devices, both ESP's included.
  • Koyn (‚≠ê66) - A decentralized Bitcoin library for the ESP32 and the ESP8266.
  • UTFT-ESP (‚≠ê91) - UTFT Support for the ESP32/8266.
  • TinyGSM (‚≠ê2.1k) - A quick and simple Arduino library for interaction with GSM modules which can also control the 8266 through AT commands.
  • mJS (‚≠ê2k) - A lightweight and restricted JS engine that is used by MongooseOS, compatible on the 32 and 8266.
  • ESPUI (‚≠ê1k) - A simply library for making interactive web interfaces for both ESP's.
  • ESP32 ePaper (‚≠ê232) - A full-featured library for using ePaper modules with the ESP32.
  • TinyUPnP (‚≠ê106) - A lightweight UPnP IGD library for automatic port forwarding on the 8266 and 32.
  • Esp32SSHClient (‚≠ê47) - A library that implements a SSH client in the ESP32.

items.title: Awesome Mobile Web Development
items.content_text:
### Articles and Documentation

*   [Adaptive loading: improving web performance on slow devices](https://web.dev/adaptive-loading-cds-2019/) - How to optimize site for specific hardware and network constraints.
*   [HTML attributes to improve your users' two factor authentication experience](https://www.twilio.com/blog/html-attributes-two-factor-authentication-autocomplete) - On autocomplete attribute regarding 2fa.
*   [Microbrowsers are Everywhere](https://24ways.org/2019/microbrowsers-are-everywhere/) - On optimizing sites for messengers.

### Talks

*   [Adaptive Loading - Improving web performance on slow devices](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=puUPpVrIRkc\&feature=emb_title) - Overview of practices for adapting a site to hardware and network constraints, by Addy Osmani, Nate Schloss.
items.content_html:

  • HTML attributes to improve your users' two factor authentication experience - On autocomplete attribute regarding 2fa.
  • Microbrowsers are Everywhere - On optimizing sites for messengers.

Talks

  • Adaptive Loading - Improving web performance on slow devices - Overview of practices for adapting a site to hardware and network constraints, by Addy Osmani, Nate Schloss.

items.title: Quick Look Plugins
items.content_text:
### Install

### Using [Homebrew](https://brew.sh)

*   Run `brew install <package>`

#### Install all

    brew install qlcolorcode qlstephen qlmarkdown quicklook-json qlimagesize suspicious-package apparency quicklookase qlvideo

##### Catalina notes

To get plugins working in Catalina, you will need to remove the quarantine attribute.

Run this to see the attributes:

    xattr -r ~/Library/QuickLook

And run this to remove the attributes:

    xattr -d -r com.apple.quarantine ~/Library/QuickLook
items.content_html:
Install

Using Homebrew

  • Run brew install <package>

Install all

brew install qlcolorcode qlstephen qlmarkdown quicklook-json qlimagesize suspicious-package apparency quicklookase qlvideo
Catalina notes

To get plugins working in Catalina, you will need to remove the quarantine attribute.

Run this to see the attributes:

xattr -r ~/Library/QuickLook

And run this to remove the attributes:

xattr -d -r com.apple.quarantine ~/Library/QuickLook

items.title: Awesome Actions
items.content_text:
### GitHub Tools and Management / Docker Container Actions

*   [Use private actions in any workflow (‚≠ê169)](https://github.com/InVisionApp/private-action-loader)

### Utility / Docker Container Actions

*   [Read Properties (‚≠ê23)](https://github.com/christian-draeger/read-properties) - Read values from `.properties` files.
*   [Write Properties (‚≠ê14)](https://github.com/christian-draeger/write-properties) - Write values to `.properties` files.

### Utility / Environments

*   [Create an envfile (‚≠ê462)](https://github.com/SpicyPizza/create-envfile)
*   [Export global environment variables for succeeding build steps (‚≠ê6)](https://github.com/zweitag/github-actions)
*   [Programmatically set environment variables for use in subsequent steps (‚≠ê51)](https://github.com/allenevans/set-env)

### Utility / Semantic Versioning

*   [Next SemVers (‚≠ê59)](https://github.com/WyriHaximus/github-action-next-semvers) - Output the next version for major, minor, and patch version based on the given semver version.

### Static Analysis / Testing

*   [xUnit Slack Reporter: Sends summary of tests from xUnit reports to a Slack channel (‚≠ê12)](https://github.com/ivanklee86/xunit-slack-reporter)
*   [Run codeception tests (‚≠ê15)](https://github.com/joelwmale/codeception-action)
*   [Run TestCafe tests (‚≠ê36)](https://github.com/DevExpress/testcafe-action)
*   [Run Unity tests (‚≠ê232)](https://github.com/webbertakken/unity-test-runner)
*   [Run Cypress E2E tests (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/cypress-io/github-action)
*   [Test Ansible roles with Molecule (‚≠ê55)](https://github.com/robertdebock/molecule-action)

### Static Analysis / Linting

*   [Runs Hadolint against a Dockerfile within a repository (‚≠ê13)](https://github.com/burdzwastaken/hadolint-action)
*   [PHP\_CodeSniffer With Annotations (‚≠ê55)](https://github.com/chekalsky/phpcs-action)
*   [Linter for markdown (with presets) (‚≠ê79)](https://github.com/avto-dev/markdown-lint)

### Static Analysis / Security

*   [AWS Secrets Manager Actions (‚≠ê63)](https://github.com/say8425/aws-secrets-manager-actions) - Define AWS Secrets Manager secrets to environment values.

### Static Analysis / Code Coverage

*   [Scan code with SonarCloud (‚≠ê607)](https://github.com/sonarsource/sonarcloud-github-action)
*   [Send your code coverage to codecov.io (‚≠ê1.6k)](https://github.com/codecov/codecov-action)
*   [Publishing code coverage to CodeClimate (‚≠ê205)](https://github.com/paambaati/codeclimate-action)

### Monitoring / Code Coverage

*   [Audit a webpage with Google Chrome's Lighthouse tests (‚≠ê347)](https://github.com/jakejarvis/lighthouse-action)
*   [Runs Lighthouse and posts results to PRs and Slack (‚≠ê499)](https://github.com/foo-software/lighthouse-check-action)
*   [Run Lighthouse in CI using GitHub Actions (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/treosh/lighthouse-ci-action)
*   [Continuous Benchmarking and Benchmark Visualization for Go (‚≠ê150)](https://github.com/bobheadxi/gobenchdata)

### Pull Requests / Code Coverage

*   [Lint pull request name with commitlint (Awesome if you squash merge !) (‚≠ê84)](https://github.com/JulienKode/pull-request-name-linter-action)

### Deployment / Code Coverage

*   [Purge Cloudflare cache after updating a website (‚≠ê139)](https://github.com/jakejarvis/cloudflare-purge-action)

### Deployment / Docker

*   [Update a Docker Hub repository description from README.md (‚≠ê352)](https://github.com/peter-evans/dockerhub-description)
*   [Publish Docker Images to the GitHub Package Registry (GPR) (‚≠ê55)](https://github.com/machine-learning-apps/gpr-docker-publish)
*   [Update a repository's "Full description" on Docker Hub (‚≠ê4)](https://github.com/mpepping/github-actions/tree/master/docker-hub-metadata)

### Deployment / Kubernetes

*   [Deploy to any Cloud or Kubernetes Using Pulumi (‚≠ê277)](https://github.com/pulumi/actions)
*   [Deploy to Kubernetes with kubectl (‚≠ê218)](https://github.com/steebchen/kubectl)
*   [Get Kubeconfig File From Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) (‚≠ê13)](https://github.com/machine-learning-apps/gke-kubeconfig)

### Deployment / AWS

*   [Sync/upload a directory to an AWS S3 bucket (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/jakejarvis/s3-sync-action)
*   [Deploy Lambda code to an existing function (‚≠ê427)](https://github.com/appleboy/lambda-action)

### Deployment / Terraform

*   [Generate terraform documentation (‚≠ê39)](https://github.com/Dirrk/terraform-docs) - Uses terraform-docs to generate docs for terraform modules.
*   [An example of using Terraform to validate and apply GitHub administration (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/asgharlabs/github-terraform/tree/master/.github/workflows)

### Build / Terraform

*   [run-cmake (‚≠ê191)](https://github.com/lukka/run-cmake) - Multi platform action to build C/C++ software with [CMake](https://cmake.org) and [Ninja](https://ninja-build.org/).
*   [run-vcpkg (‚≠ê215)](https://github.com/lukka/run-vcpkg) - Multi platform action to build and install C/C++ dependencies with [vcpkg (‚≠ê25k)](https://github.com/microsoft/vcpkg).
*   [Build Go applications for multiplatform (‚≠ê6)](https://github.com/izumin5210/action-go-crossbuild)
items.content_html:
GitHub Tools and Management / Docker Container Actions

  • Use private actions in any workflow (‚≠ê169)

Utility / Docker Container Actions

  • Read Properties (‚≠ê23) - Read values from .properties files.
  • Write Properties (‚≠ê14) - Write values to .properties files.

Utility / Environments

  • Create an envfile (‚≠ê462)
  • Export global environment variables for succeeding build steps (‚≠ê6)
  • Programmatically set environment variables for use in subsequent steps (‚≠ê51)

Utility / Semantic Versioning

  • Next SemVers (‚≠ê59) - Output the next version for major, minor, and patch version based on the given semver version.

Static Analysis / Testing

  • xUnit Slack Reporter: Sends summary of tests from xUnit reports to a Slack channel (‚≠ê12)
  • Run codeception tests (‚≠ê15)
  • Run TestCafe tests (‚≠ê36)
  • Run Unity tests (‚≠ê232)
  • Run Cypress E2E tests (‚≠ê1.4k)
  • Test Ansible roles with Molecule (‚≠ê55)

Static Analysis / Linting

  • Runs Hadolint against a Dockerfile within a repository (‚≠ê13)
  • PHP_CodeSniffer With Annotations (‚≠ê55)
  • Linter for markdown (with presets) (‚≠ê79)

Static Analysis / Security

  • AWS Secrets Manager Actions (‚≠ê63) - Define AWS Secrets Manager secrets to environment values.

Static Analysis / Code Coverage

  • Scan code with SonarCloud (‚≠ê607)
  • Send your code coverage to codecov.io (‚≠ê1.6k)
  • Publishing code coverage to CodeClimate (‚≠ê205)

Monitoring / Code Coverage

  • Audit a webpage with Google Chrome's Lighthouse tests (‚≠ê347)
  • Runs Lighthouse and posts results to PRs and Slack (‚≠ê499)
  • Run Lighthouse in CI using GitHub Actions (‚≠ê1.2k)
  • Continuous Benchmarking and Benchmark Visualization for Go (‚≠ê150)

Pull Requests / Code Coverage

  • Lint pull request name with commitlint (Awesome if you squash merge !) (‚≠ê84)

Deployment / Code Coverage

  • Purge Cloudflare cache after updating a website (‚≠ê139)

Deployment / Docker

  • Update a Docker Hub repository description from README.md (‚≠ê352)
  • Publish Docker Images to the GitHub Package Registry (GPR) (‚≠ê55)
  • Update a repository's "Full description" on Docker Hub (‚≠ê4)

Deployment / Kubernetes

  • Deploy to any Cloud or Kubernetes Using Pulumi (‚≠ê277)
  • Deploy to Kubernetes with kubectl (‚≠ê218)
  • Get Kubeconfig File From Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) (‚≠ê13)

Deployment / AWS

  • Sync/upload a directory to an AWS S3 bucket (‚≠ê1.1k)
  • Deploy Lambda code to an existing function (‚≠ê427)

Deployment / Terraform

  • Generate terraform documentation (‚≠ê39) - Uses terraform-docs to generate docs for terraform modules.
  • An example of using Terraform to validate and apply GitHub administration (‚≠ê2)

Build / Terraform

  • run-cmake (‚≠ê191) - Multi platform action to build C/C++ software with CMake and Ninja.
  • run-vcpkg (‚≠ê215) - Multi platform action to build and install C/C++ dependencies with vcpkg (‚≠ê25k).
  • Build Go applications for multiplatform (‚≠ê6)
